Tract Maps and Cadastral Maps of Southern California Collection

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Collection of Tract Maps and Cadastral Maps of Southern California
did.abstract: The tract and cadastral maps in this collection are of real estate developments located in Los Angeles, Orange, Riverside and Ventura counties. The maps are listed by location using the Thomas Brothers Maps' Los Angeles County Popular Street Atlas, 1931 and Orange County, 1981. A few maps fall outside of this territory, and for these, relevant leaves of the Thomas ... Riverside County, 1978, and Ventura County, 1979, have been included.
did.langmaterial: Finding aid is written in English.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of California, Los Angeles. Library Special Collections.

did.physloc: Stored off-site at SRLF. Advance notice is required for access to the collection. Please contact UCLA Library Special Collections for paging information.

daodesc.p: Selected digitized images from this collection.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. STORED OFF-SITE AT SRLF. Advance notice is required for access to the collection. Please contact UCLA Library Special Collections for paging information.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical object belong to the UC Regents. Literary rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Collection of Tract Maps and Cadastral Maps of Southern California (Collection 349). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: Tract maps present certain problems in indexing or cataloging since they do not all have a common element such as a name or a cartographer. The approach, therefore, that seems most logical is to list the maps by location. The locator used by the Cadastral Map Collection is the Thomas Brothers Maps' Los Angeles County Popular Street Atlas, 1931 and Orange County, 1981. A few maps fall outside of this territory, and for these, eleven leaves of the Thomas ... Riverside County, 1978, and Ventura County, 1979, have been included. The location is designated by atlas page number and grid coordinates (the area where the letters printed across the top of the page intersect the numbers printed down the side). This location designation has been used as the call number of individual maps.

There are various ways of approaching this collection. If the name of a tract is known, it is listed alphabetically in the finding aid. In addition, there are chronological and location (call) number lists. Few maps have all of these elements. If the location of the tract map is all that is known, the Thomas Atlas must be checked to find a location designation. The finding aid must then be consulted to see if a map exists for that location.

When more than one tract appears on a map, each tract has been given its own location designation. The first such location designation has been used for the call number and all other tracts have bee cited with a see reference to that number.
Where information about the owner or realtor is available, it has been included in the finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of tract and cadastral maps of real estate developments, some projected but never realized, located in Los Angeles and vicinity. Most tracts are located in Los Angeles and Orange counties, but some are in Riverside and Ventura counties. Tracts are listed alphabetically, chronologically, and by location (call) number in the finding aid.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is arranged alphabetically by name of tract.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: A Collection of Tract Maps From a Real Estate Business Scrapbook, Los Angeles (Collection 295) . Available at the UCLA Library Special Collections.
